title: 108_hr3773
content: The "Tax Relief Guarantee Act of 2004" is cited as the short title. It repeals Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 and the scheduled reductions in tax benefits provided by the Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003. The "Tax Relief Guarantee Act of 2004" repeals certain tax benefits and amends the Child Tax Credit and Marriage Penalty Relief in Standard Deduction. The Child Tax Credit is amended to allow a $1,000 credit per qualifying child. The Marriage Penalty Relief increases the basic standard deduction for joint returns and surviving spouses. The Tax Relief Guarantee Act of 2004 amends the Child Tax Credit and Marriage Penalty Relief. It increases the credit to $1,000 per qualifying child and raises the standard deduction for joint returns and surviving spouses. Marriage penalty relief in the 15-percent income tax bracket is also eliminated. The Tax Relief Guarantee Act of 2004 adjusts tax rate brackets and taxable income amounts, with the 10-percent rate bracket being amended for inflation adjustment. The Tax Relief Guarantee Act of 2004 adjusts tax rate brackets and taxable income amounts, with the 10-percent rate bracket being amended for inflation adjustment. Additionally, 1(i)(1) is amended to include a permanent reduction in capital gains rates for individuals. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is repealed, and amendments are made to expensing under Section 179 and bonus depreciation for certain property acquired after May 5, 2003. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is repealed, and amendments are made to expensing under Section 179 and bonus depreciation for certain property acquired after May 5, 2003. In 2003, an additional allowance of 50 percent of the adjusted basis of qualified property is provided for the depreciation deduction in the taxable year the property is placed in service. The adjusted basis of the property is then reduced by this deduction before computing the depreciation deduction for that year and subsequent years. Conforming amendments are made to section 168(k)(2). The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is repealed, and amendments are made to expensing under Section 179 and bonus depreciation for certain property acquired after May 5, 2003. Section 168(k)(2) is amended to include new clauses regarding the acquisition and use of property after May 5, 2003. Amendments are made to bonus depreciation rules for property acquired after May 5, 2003. Section 168(k)(2) is updated to include new clauses for property placed in service during taxable years. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2004, with bonus depreciation rules for property placed in service after May 5, 2003.
